name: qlaxr1i

body.origin:
|- wceq(c0, c1)
-| wceq(c0, c1)
-| wcel(c1, cch)

cumulated.origin:
|- wceq(c0, c1)
-| wceq(c0, c1)
-| wcel(c1, cch)

body.origin:
|- wceq(c0, c1)
-| wceq(c0, c1)
-| wcel(c0, cch)

cumulated.origin:
|- wceq(c0, c1)
-| wcel(c1, cch)
-| wceq(c0, c1)
-| wcel(c0, cch)
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ c0 = c1
⊣ c1 ∈ CH
⊣ c0 = c1
⊣ c0 ∈ CH

cumulated.origin:
|- wceq(c0, c1)
-| wcel(c1, cch)
-| wcel(c0, cch)
-| wceq(c1, c0)
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ c0 = c1
⊣ c1 ∈ CH
⊣ c0 ∈ CH
⊣ c1 = c0

comment: One of the conditions showing ` CH ` is an ortholattice. (This corresponds to axiom "ax-r1" in the Quantum Logic Explorer.) (Contributed by NM, 4-Aug-2004.) (New usage is discouraged.)
